channel.title: 3D Castle
channel.description:
Im working on a 3D environment in 3D modeling package called Lightwave, in going to be updating this around every week with new renders when I get more into the model, so far i've just completed the gate with grill, now im working on the walls;
The finished model will have a moat going fully around the castle, then some height maps (Mountains n stuff) so it doesn't look like a flat terrain!!
- You might see this in a mod im creating with some friends :)
Gate + start of walls (This will be updated in about 3 hours, im posting from my aunts!)
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll245/mjownzu_07/gatewall_v1.png[/img]
V2!
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll245/mjownzu_07/v2.png[/img]

item.title: 3D Castle
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:4, topic:344287”][quote author=mongoth666 link=topic=440670.msg3237822#msg3237822 date=1276634402]
It cant be put into runescape sad to say, you have to make castles simular to the way you add terrain spaces. Like ex. If you put runescape on its lowest graphic settings, you can see each square that they dropped like tiles. You do the same for a wall, drop it on a tile, and put a single piece next to each other.

It is possible to put your castle in a server, if you stay under the poly limit. But if it successfully projects, you will need to add collision data to it, or else it will start flashing and you will walk through it.
[/quote]

split the castle up into seperate models and then load them as seperate objects then throw em on a map. Its not as hard as you make it out to be, but regardless its no easy task.[/quote]

Suppose this is more of a “show off” This wont be going into RS, but instead a mod using the source engine, or crytek

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Castle
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“mongoth666, post:3, topic:344287”]It cant be put into runescape sad to say, you have to make castles simular to the way you add terrain spaces. Like ex. If you put runescape on its lowest graphic settings, you can see each square that they dropped like tiles. You do the same for a wall, drop it on a tile, and put a single piece next to each other.

It is possible to put your castle in a server, if you stay under the poly limit. But if it successfully projects, you will need to add collision data to it, or else it will start flashing and you will walk through it.[/quote]

split the castle up into seperate models and then load them as seperate objects then throw em on a map. Its not as hard as you make it out to be, but regardless its no easy task.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Castle
item.dc:creator: @mongoth666 mongoth666
item.description:
@mongoth666 wrote:

It cant be put into runescape sad to say, you have to make castles simular to the way you add terrain spaces. Like ex. If you put runescape on its lowest graphic settings, you can see each square that they dropped like tiles. You do the same for a wall, drop it on a tile, and put a single piece next to each other.

It is possible to put your castle in a server, if you stay under the poly limit. But if it successfully projects, you will need to add collision data to it, or else it will start flashing and you will walk through it.

Read full topic
